Murad is single and lives with his parents in Imishli. He has a small grocery store which is located near his home. His family has been running the grocery store for 10 years and earns an income from this business. This is the only source of income for the family. They have a lot of customers. 

Murad is 25 years old, and a young man who has a very good reputation in his community. His neighbors and his friends have a very good opinion of him. Murad requested the loan of an amount of 1,500 AZN from Kiva partner AqroInvest CU. He will use his loan to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
Reina is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a sari-sari or convenience store business for several years now. She also sells cooked snack foods to the people in the community. This is the source of her daily income.

Reina plans to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. She is asking for a loan worth 8,000 PHP to buy more stock to sell in her store such as canned goods, shampoo and detergents, and ingredients for cooking. With this, Reina dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store such as canned goods, shampoo and detergents, and ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of two children aged 12 and ten. She is a merchant and sells different kinds of products to the people in the locality. She sells ready to-wear-garments such as shirts and pants as well as household and kitchen materials.

Teodula has been engaged in this business for more than ten years now. This is where she gets her daily income which helps to meet some of the needs of the family especially the schooling of her two children.

In the future, Teodula dreams of making her business a successful one. Moreover, she wants to send her children to school continuously so that they can learn better and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as ready-to-wear garments and household materials.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is patiently selling fruit to people in the public market. He is married to Gina, a mother, who helps him to manages their business. Together, they are raising their children. The couple wants to provide a good education for their children, so they have been running this business for almost six years now and earn about PHP 4,000 monthly. 

This time, Albert is borrowing a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy citrus fruits and mangoes to sell. Albert would like to increase his sales. The couple is working toward the diversification of their business and with the aim of keeping on providing better service to their customers.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruits and mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Chheang's Group

texts.en:
Aged 57, Chheang is a rural villager in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married with seven children, one of whom is still dependent on her and helps the family’s business. She is a housewife who takes care of her child while her husband owns a small construction business in the village. The business earns him about 26,000 KHR per day. Lacking working capital to support the construction business is the main challenge for her husband’s business.

Chheang has been with VisionFund for five cycles while the other member in her group has been with VisionFund for three cycles. The past loans have helped her family to have sufficient food to eat. Now she and her group member are requesting a loan from VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR and 200,000 KHR, respectively. With her portion, she is going to buy construction materials for her husband’s business. She hopes to have sufficient materials for his construction works so that the workers can perform the work faster and more money will be generated, and as a result her family can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Sreypin

texts.en:
Sreypin lives in Thmor Koul district located in Battamabng province, Cambodia. She is 30 years old and has two dependent sons, both of whom help the family’s business. Sreypin is a cloth-seller and her husband is a barber in the local area to help the family generate their income. They have been in these business for almost ten years. Lack of working capital is the main challenge for Sreypin's business. 

Sreypin is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. She is asking for a loan of US$ 1,000 to buy a motorbike for her family to travel to work. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a proper motorbike for commuting which in return will save them some time when travelling to work and back home.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting to work and back home.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
Sarun, 53, lives with his wife in a rural area of Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He has six children, two of whom are dependent on the family and still in school. For four years, he has made a living through selling homemade Soya milk and coffee in the local area, while his wife supplements the family’s income by selling grocery items. The current business earns him about 12,000 KHR per day and allows him to save about 8,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. However, lack of working capital is still the main challenge for his business. 

Sarun’s group consists of two males and this is the seventh loan for his group with VisionFund. The past loans have helped him to have sufficient food and support his children’s education. He and his group member are applying for a loan of 1,100,000KHR each. As the leader, Sarun will use his share to buy more grocery items for his wife to sell such as eggs, salt, sugar and so on. He hopes to increase his income further through selling these grocery products so as to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman is a 53-year-old married man from Imishli. He is living with his wife and two sons. He has owned a small grocery store for 15 years, selling cheese, juices, bread, daily use and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

Elman requested to borrow 1,000 AZN from Kiva's partner, AqroInvest CU, to increase his shop’s inventory. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to increase his shop’s inventory.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is 20 years old, married, and the father of one daughter. Samir has been a wheat farmer for the last 2 years, and he also raises livestock. Samir's wife supports him in farming. This is his first loan, which he spent on preparing land for planting wheat and the remaining amount on buying some livestock. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for planting wheat and to buy some livestock

loans.name: Aliaga

texts.en: Aliaga, a 59-year-old man who lives in Imishli with his wife and their four children, has owned a grocery store for almost 10 years. He decided to start this business because he wanted to work independently. He sells canned food, candies, drinks, eggs, bread, etc.. Aliaga is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients who are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan, his first, from AqroInvest in order to purchase merchandise for his store. When Aliaga first started his business, he successfully confronted both financial issues and competition. In the future, he plans to expand his enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the store

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Marlene works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Marlene is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza works hard to support her family. Riza is single and has a shell craft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. Riza requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

In the future, Riza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shell craft business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, de 65 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, además de alegre y sociable, es separada del padre de sus 2 hijas: Mia Cecilia de 24 y Auda de 22 años de edad y su nieto. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Antonia es la venta de bebidas gasificadas, para lo cual cuenta con una refrigeradora en su propia casa, en donde puede guardar su producto a la temperatura que le agrada a su público consumidor, quienes compran para llevar a tomar en otros lugares,  y no toman en la casa de Antonia.
Dedicándose a dicha actividad hace más de 3 años,  y contando con la ayuda de su hija en la venta del producto a los clientes. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera, y poder apoyar a su familia con algunos gastos, también le gusta el tiempo libre que tiene y lo puede usar en otras actividades. 
Por otro lado, comenta que en ésta actividad no se pierde por ser un producto de bastante consumo, en toda actividad social ya que siempre tiene demanda. Este es el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera a sus miembros ser personas comprometidas con sus obligaciones y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de su mercadería, ósea las bebidas gasificadas en variados sabores y marcas, buscando precios bajos por el volumen de sus compras, de esa manera espera aumentar su margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Antonia is 65 years old. She is a hardworking and dynamic woman, in addition to being cheerful and sociable. She is separated from the father of her two daughters: Mia Cecilia, 24 and Auda, 22. She also has a grandson. They live together in their own home. Antonia's activity is selling soft drinks, for which she has a refirgerator in her house. She keeps her products there at the temperature the consumers like. The customers buy the drinks to drink somewhere else; they don't drink them in Antonia's house.

She has done this activity for more than 3 years. She has the help of her daughter for selling the product to her customers. She considers her business to be profitable because of the earnings it brings in. She is able to pay some of her family's expenses. She also likes the free time that she has that she uses doing other activities.
 
She also says that she has no losses because it is a very popular product used in every social gathering and for which there is always a demand. This is loan number 6 for the MFP institution and she is committed  to making her payments on time. She is also happy with her communal bank, because she considers the members to be committed and supportive people. 

With the amount she has asked for, 2500 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying merchandise, that is, different flavors and brands of soft drinks, seeking low prices by buying in bulk. This way, she hopes she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy various flavors and brands of soft drinks.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Albertina, ahora tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se dedica a la   Ganadería, principalmente a la producción y venta  de leche. Albertina necesita producir más leche para cubrir con su demanda, por ello invertirá su préstamo solicitado en  comprar una vaca lechera.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Albertina pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
Albertina quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, así que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en la educación de ellos.
texts.en:
This member's name is Albertina. She is 37 years old, married and has 2 children. She lives in the Tambo Real district in the province of Anta. She works raising cattle, mainly producing and selling milk. Albertina needs to produce more milk to cover the demand. That is why she will invest the loan in buying a dairy cow.

She is very grateful to KIVA for helping her develop this activity. She is committed to making her payments on time. Albertina belongs to the “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” communal bank in the district of Tambo Real in the province of  Anta in Cuzco – Peru.

Albertina wants to giver her children a better life and education. She sacrifices for them and hopes to work a lot and save to invest their education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her fish-vending business.

Haidee has been in this business for one year. Haidee earns additional income from a general store.

Haidee has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en: Abdurahim is married and has five children. Abdurahim is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for his children. He began his own business dealing in animal husbandry when his children were little. He requested a loan for the amount of 3,000 USD to buy feed for cows. He hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve his family's income.

loans.use: To buy feed for cows.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for a year. Alice requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

In the future, Alice would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice farming business in the Philippines. Margarita is borrowing 3,500 PHP through NWTF to buy a SOLAR. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Margarita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Nora has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

Nora is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice business. Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Doña Elsa tiene 57 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula.  Hace un año que doña Elsa ha puesto su propio negocio de venta de mercadería, vende ropa, zapatos, sandalias, carteras, artículos plásticos, etc. este negocio lo tiene en su casa y ya tiene sus clientes fijos. Con el préstamo que solicita por 12,000 lempiras va comprar mercadería nueva para surtir el negocio, ya que teniendo su inventario con variedad de productos va incrementar las ventas. Su plan es que el negocio crezca y se mantenga activo porque es una fuente de ingresos de la familia.
texts.en:
Elsa, age 57, is married and has two children.  She lives in Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula.

A year ago Elsa established her own business of selling merchandise.  She sells clothes, shoes, sandals, wallets, and plastic items, etc.  This business is in her house, and she now has fixed customers.

With the 12,000 lempira loan she is requesting she will buy new merchandise to stock the business.  Having an inventory of a variety of products will increase her sales.  Her plan is for her business to grow and stay active because it is a source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, sandals, plastic items, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Rosa, ahora tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia continua dedicándose  a la   Ganadería, principalmente a la producción y venta  de leche y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Rosa necesita producir más leche para cubrir con su demanda, por ello invertirá su préstamo solicitado en  comprar una vaca lechera.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is Rosa, who is now 57 years old. She is married and has six children. She lives in the district of Tambo Real, in Anta province. She still works with livestock, mainly producing and selling milk and also raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. Rosa needs to produce more milk to meet demand, which is why she will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of a milk cow.

Member Rosa is very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her business and she is committed to paying her installments on time. She belongs to the communal bank San Bartolo de Tambo Real in the district of Tambo Real, within Anta province in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y muy carismática. Está casada con  Marden quien es obrero, llevan viviendo muchos años juntos, fruto de esa unión tienen 4 hijos: los 3 mayores de ellos ya son independientes. Juntos viven en compañía de su última hija Janise de 21 años de edad en su propia casa.
La  actividad que realiza Isabel es la venta de helados de una marca reconocida y bebidas gasificadas de diversos sabores y marcas, contando con un refrigerador instalado  en su propia casa que logró comprar con sus propios ingresos, comenta que en temporada de verano tiene bastante demanda, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes. Empezó éste negocio con su esposo hace más de 4 años con un préstamo de MFP, con el que pagaban parte de sus gastos, y hasta en momento le sigue apoyando en sus ratos libres.
Le gusta su actividad por el ingreso económico con el cual logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ahora que tiene a su última hija en su casa, le brinda  educación, como hizo con sus  hijos mayores.
Así como también sigue en el negocio por la necesidad de contar un ingreso económico  y sentirse una persona productiva, comenta que realizando ésta actividad siempre lo tiene  presente, y desea continuar, buscando hacerlo crecer y tener mayores ganancias. Este es el préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, por eso se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con el plago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su grupo de su banco comunal, considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad en más productos para su negocio como los helados de marca y bebidas gaseosas de diversos sabores y marcas,  para tener un stock disponible para la venta, así podrá tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Isabel, 52, is a hardworking, happy and charismatic woman. She is married to Marden, who is a laborer, and they have been together for many years. They have four children as the fruit of their union; the oldest three are already self-supporting. The couple lives with their youngest daughter, Janise, 21, in their own home.

Isabel has a business selling a well known brand-name ice cream and different flavors and brands of soft drinks. She has a refrigerator installed in her house that she was able to  purchase with her own earnings. She notes that there is a great demand for her products during the summer months, when she is busy waiting on her customers. 

She started this business with her husband more than four years ago with a loan from MFP and it has helped pay for part of their expenses. Her husband still helps her in his spare time. She likes her business because of the income, which pays for household expenses. Now that she has her last daughter at home, she is also able to provide her with an education as she did for her older children.

She also continues running her business not only due to the need to have an income but also in order to feel that she is a productive person. She notes that running this business always keeps her active and she wants to continue looking for ways to make it grow and earn higher profits. 

This is her 13th loan from MFP and she is pleased with the financial support that she has been receiving. Consequently she is committed to continuing to make her payments on time as she has done with previous loans. She is also pleased with her communal bank and considers its members to be responsible and supportive people. She will use all of the money she has requested, S/. 3,000, to buy more products for her business, such as brand-name ice cream and various flavors and brands of soft drinks. Thus she will the stock available to sell and be able to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase various flavors of soft drinks and ice cream.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has six children. 

Alejandro provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 12 years. 

He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

Alejandro has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Alejandro hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Jimmy Abraham

texts.es: Jimmy estudia la carera de derecho, paga sus estudios por medio de la ayuda que le brinda sus padres, le interesa su profesión por lo que piensa trabajar en ella superarse, ayudar con los gastos básicos de la familia y deudas, dice que el programa de apoyo es muy excelente ya que ayuda a jóvenes de escasos recursos y la manera de optar al préstamo es bien fácil. Solicita el crédito para el pago del curso de titulación, último paso para culminar su carrera.
texts.en: Jimmy is studying law. He pays for his studies with the help his parents give him. He is interested in the profession because he is planning on getting ahead with it, helping with the family's basic expenses and debts. He says that the support program is excellent because it helps low income young people. In addition, it is easy to take out the loan. He is asking for the loan to pay for a graduation course, the last step to finishing his degree.

loans.use: to pay for a graduation course

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items like soft-drinks, biscuits and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Ma. Lydia

texts.en:
Ma. Lydia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a shell-craft business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shell-craft business.

NWTF is relisting Ma. Lydia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell-craft business.

loans.name: Jelma

texts.en:
Jelma is 37 years old and married with 3 children who are in school. Jelma is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a local eatery business in the Philippines. Jelma has been in this business for 2 years. Jelma requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

 In the future, Jelma would like to build and expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda works hard to support her three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Glenda requested a PHP 3,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Glenda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Hugo Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo tiene 47 años tiene un hija de la edad de 16 años, el tiene el oficio de artesano, el  realiza rompecabezas de venestas con motivos infantiles, los comercializa al por mayor, realiza sus entregas sobre todo en la feria de la tablada donde ya tiene clientes que le hacen su pedido cada semana, también en algunas ocasiones viaja a la ciudad de Oruro y Cochabamba le va muy bien con los viajes al interior de país,  el Sr.  Hugo vive solo, actualmente vive en anticrético, con su hermana y su sobrina, el utilizara el crédito para la compra de una material para la fabricación de rompecabezas y de esta manera optimizara su trabajo, ahora ya quiere fabricar en mayor cantidad por la cantidad de pedidos que tiene y también porque ya se acerca la época de fin de año y tiene mucha demanda de sus productos,  Su sueño más grande es darle lo mejor a su hija  ya que es por quien trabaja.
texts.en:
Hugo is 47 years old and has a daughter who is 16. He is an artisan who makes jigsaw puzzles with themes for very young children. Hugo sells them at wholesale, especially at La Tablada market where he has customers who order weekly. Also, on occasion, he travels to the cities of Oruro and Cochabamba. His trips to the interior do very well. Hugo lives alone, currently with a special rental contract [cash up front, refunded at the end], with his sister and niece.

Hugo will use the loan to buy material for making jigsaw puzzles and, in this manner, optimize his work. Now, Hugo wishes to make a larger quantity of puzzles, to fill his growing orders and, also, because the end of the year is approaching and there will be much demand for his products.

Hugo's major dream is to provide the best for his daughter, since it is for her benefit that he works.

loans.use: buy materials for making jigsaw puzzles.

loans.name: Fredy Nain

texts.es: Fredy, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en el municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara con su conyugue. Fredy trabajo varios años en una compañía privada y de sus ahorros estableció hace 6 meses su negocio de pulpería. Este negocio tiene buena ubicación y buena clientela, donde vende granos básicos, manteca, huevos, harina, azúcar, condimentos, leche, refrescos, productos de limpieza etc. el préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en compra de productos para surtir la pulpería. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio y en el futuro construir una casa
texts.en:
Fredy, age 31, lives with his wife in the San Marcos municipality of Santa Bárbara.

Fredy worked for several years for a private company.  He used his savings to establish a grocery store business six months ago.  This business is in a good location and has good clientele.  He sells basic grains, lard, eggs, flour, sugar, condiments, milk, soft drinks, and cleaning products, etc.

He will use the 10,000 lempira loan that he is requesting to buy products to stock his grocery store.  His plan is to make his business grow and to, in the future, build a house.

loans.use: to buy food products like basic grains, canned goods, soft drinks, and cleaning products to stock his business.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Ernestina, ahora tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se sigue dedicando a la  Ganadeía, en la producción y venta  lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt y los comercializa en los mercados y ferias de su provincia. Ernestina necesita más leche para elaborar sus productos, por ello invertirá su préstamo solicitado en  comprar más leche.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Ernestina pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
Ernestina quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, así que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en la educación de ellos.
texts.en:
This member is Ernestina, who is now forty years old. She is married with two children. She lives in the district of Tambo Real in Anta province. She is still working as a dairy farmer, producing and selling dairy products such as milk, cheese, and yogurt. She sells them in the different markets in her province. Ernestina needs more milk to make her products, which is why she will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of more milk.

Member Ernestina is very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her business and is committed to paying her installments on time. She belongs to the communal bank San Bartolo de Tambo Real in the district of Tambo Real, within Anta province in Cusco, Peru.

Ernestina wants to provide her children with a better life and an education. She makes sacrifices for them and wants to work hard and save money so that she can invest in their education.

loans.use: to purchase milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make viand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is 39 years old. She is married and has four children. 

Adoracion is a responsible mother who is engaged in buying and selling vegetables in the market. She has been in her business for 20 years. She usually earns about PHP 1,500 a week. 

Adoracion wants to buy more vegetables to sell. In this regard, Adoracion is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy a variety of vegetables such as onion, garlic, tomatoes, string beans and squash to sell. With continuous patience and hard work, Adoracion's family will achieve a better way of life some day.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables such as onion, garlic, tomatoes, string beans and squash to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different kinds of fish to resell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is married and blessed with three children. 

To provide sustenance for the family, she sells fruits and vegetables to people in the market. She had been doing it for over 20 years now. She is happy with the kind of business she has even though she generates only minimal income from it. She usually acquires about PHP 3,000 each month selling fruits and vegetables. 

She would like to increase her sales capacity to improve her income, but she has insufficient funds now. She would like to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy cabbages, bananas, tomatoes, squash, onions and garlic to sell. With continuous patience and hard work, Estrella's family will achieve a better way of life some day.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, bananas, tomatoes, squash, onions and garlic to sell.

loans.name: Thun's Group

texts.en:
Thun is 38 years old and has six children, five of whom are dependent on her.  Some are in school, some work for others for fees. Her family lives in a rural village of Sangke district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. 

Thun has been involved in farming rice for 12 years, while her husband is a fishermen. A low crop yield is still the main challenge for her business. 

Thun is leading a loan group of three females, all of whom live in the same village. The first loan has helped Thun to better support her business. And now, Thun and her group members are applying for another loan with VisionFund. 

Thun, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow rice with higher yield, so that she can sell the rice for higher income. Then all her children can remain in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie is single and has a general store in the Philippines. She has had this business for five years and she works hard to support her family.

Emilie is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Agustinus

texts.en:
Agustinus is a student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He wants to work at a major port. His parents only work as farmers and their income is uncertain. While his parents' income is just enough to cover the day-to-day family needs, Agustinus has five brothers who still require school fees. 

Agustinus wants to help his parents for the betterment of the lives of his family and his five brothers and sisters. With the student loan program of Kiva, he wants to continue his studies. He is very grateful to all investors of Kiva, who will help him in his studies, although they do not know him personally.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Khusen

texts.ru:
Хусену 62 года. Он живет с женой, детьми (невестками) и внуками. У них очень большая и дружная семья. Хусен является отцом шестерых детей. Жена Хусена глава ассоциации женщин села Айвоч. 
Хусен имеет 8 лет рабочего стажа, он 8 лет проработал учителем в средней школе. Более шести лет Хусен совмещал преподавание и животноводство. Конечно, совмещать две профессии ему было нелегко, но на зарплату учителя он не мог прокормить свою семью. Хусен разводит телят и бычков у себя дома в дальнейшем для продажи. Он просит кредит для закупа несколько голов телят и двух голов бычков.
texts.en:
Khusen is 62 years old. He is a father of six and lives together with his wife, children, children-in-law, and grandchildren. Their family is large and peaceful. Khusen's wife is the head of the women's association of the Aivoch village. Khusen has been employed for the past 8 years as a high school teacher. For over six years, he has been also raising livestock. Naturally, working two jobs simultaneously has been difficult, but Khusen's teacher's salary alone is insufficient to provide for his family.

Khusen raises calves at home for subsequent sale. He is requesting this loan to purchase several male and female calves.

loans.use: to purchase several male and female calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Fitim

texts.en:
Fitim is a 30-year-old recently married male. He lives in a small village of Kosovo with his wife and his entire family. Fitim works as a security guard but earns a low salary. To cover the family expenses, he is also working with some family members in their agricultural business. 

Using a tractor, they cultivate and maintain the properties of others in order to generate income. Until now, the family had used one of the uncle’s tractors, which was considered common property, but as he has recently separated from them, Fitim has remained without the use of a tractor. Fitim is requesting a loan in order to purchase a tractor. With the help of this loan, he can expand the number and frequency of the work he completes; thereby, generating a larger income for his family. 

He appreciates all of Kiva's lenders!

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 69 years old and married. For the past 10 years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from selling rice. Alicia has borrowed and repaid 13 previous loans through NWTF to purchase stock to sell. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Alicia is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Maram is a 41-year-old married woman who has four family members. She is from Jubeiha, Amman, Jordan. 

Maram is requesting a 600 JOD loan to buy household products to resell to her friends and neighbors. In the future, she would like to expand her business project and open a shop to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy household products to resell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 40 years old and single.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalinda has been farming rice for three years, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза родилась 1991 году. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она студентка 4-го курса Технологического Университета. Она учится на договорной основе по специальности Международный менеджмент. В этом году ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебу. Шахноза запрашивает кредит для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shahnoza was born in 1991. She is single and lives with her parents. Shahnoza is a 4th-year student at the Technological University, where she studies International Management. Unfortunately, this year her parents are unable to pay for her education, and so Shahnoza is requesting a loan to cover her university tuition. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university studies

loans.name: Bonevasius

texts.en:
The reason Bonevasius attends lectures at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara is that he would like to work in port administration in Indonesia. He comes from the village of Kapuas Hulu, in the upper Kapuas River, the largest river in Kalimantan Island, Indonesia. The local conditions and the situation of his origin motivate him to learn and aspire to be a professional employee in a harbor. 

However, Bonevasius faces difficulties in his studies because his two parents have died. During this time, he was funded by his siblings, but his siblings are now married and each has a child. The income of the siblings is not fixed because they are only laborers, and they also have to pay for their children who are still in school. Bonevasius hopes to get a loan from Kiva through the student loan program. He is very grateful to Kiva investors who are willing to help him to continue his studies.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 62 years old and married with eight children. For the past 10 years, she has run a general store. Delia also earns an income from raising pigs. She has borrowed and repaid 13 previous loans from NWTF and she works hard to provide for her family. 

Delia is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy rice grains, snack foods, and other grocery products to sell. She aspires to save enough to expand her business and do some house improvements.

loans.use: to buy rice, snack foods, and grocery products to sell

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Miguela works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling spices in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs.  

Miguela is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of spice to sell for her business.

Miguela has sustained her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Olan

texts.en:
Olan is a 19-year-old student. He is living alone and away from his parents. Olan's parents live in a remote village in rural Sepauk, Sintang, Indonesia. His father works as a laborer only on a rubber plantation; his income is not fixed. The income of rubber labourers is inadequate because the price of rubber is very low at this time. His parents want their children to be in school for their future happiness. Thanks to his parents' encouragement, Olan is determined to study at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara, as Olan's ideal is to work at a port in Indonesia. 

Due to the economic conditions of his parents, who are not permanent workers, Olan volunteered to seek a student loan from Kiva in order to relieve the burden on his parents and continue his studies. Olan is very grateful to the lenders from around the world, who would help him in his studies, although he does not personally know them.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Porm's Group

texts.en:
Porm is the 64-year-old father of five children, two of whom are dependent on him and still in school. 

The main source of his family’s income is rice farming, which they have done for forty years. Porm is also a village chief in a village in Sangke district, a district in Battambang province. This agribusiness earns him about KHR 36,000 per day and allows him to save about KHR 10,000 each day after offsetting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for his rice business. 

Porm has been with VisionFund for two cycles, while his fellow female member is new to VisionFund. The past loans have helped to run his business well. 

Now he is leading a group of two to apply for a loan. Porm, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland. 

He expects that this loan will allow him to grow fruitful crops, so as to improve his family's standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa además de ser amable y solidaria. Es conviviente con Aurelio quien es obrero de construcción civil, y fruto de esa unión tiene 03 hijos a los que quiere mucho. Juntos habitan cómodamente  su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Gladis es la confección y venta de ropas interiores de damas y caballeros, para lo cual cuenta con una maquina que compró con sus ahorros y aprendiendo por cuenta propia viendo a sus amistades y ayudándolas. También vende comidas tanto desayunos como almuerzos en el frontis de su casa.
Iniciándose hace más de 21 años en la costura, 3 años en la venta de comidas, confeccionando primero para sus familiares y vecinos, ahora ha logrado hacer crecer sus clientes gracias a sus buenos trabajos, contando con la ayuda de su hermana quien también está aprendiendo éste oficio de costura.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su negocio ya que puede contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Por lo contrario, no le gusta el cansancio físico que le ocasiona estar en una misma postura, pero aun así desea continuar trabajando y ampliar su negocio confeccionando faldas y blusas para surtir su negocio. Este es el préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP, por tanto cuenta con su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por  otro lado comenta estar cómoda con el grupo de su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para costura como telas, blondas elásticas y otros, los cuales los traerá desde la capital buscando precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Gladis, 52 years old, is a hardworking woman who is also caring and friendly. She lives with her partner, Aurelio, who is a civil construction worker and they have three children as the fruit of their union whom they love greatly. Together they live comfortably in their own home.

Gladis has a business making and selling underwear for ladies and gentlemen. She has a machine that she bought with her savings and learned to sew on her own by watching her friends and helping them. She also sells meals, breakfasts as well as lunches, in front of her house. She started sewing more than 21 years and selling food three years ago. She sewed first for her relatives and neighbors but has now succeeded in expanding her customer base thanks to her fine work. She relies on help from her sister, who is also learning the skills of a seamstress.

She feels her business is successful because of the good profit it generates. She likes her business because she can count on an income to help her husband with household expenses. On the other hand, she does not enjoy the physical fatigue she endures from maintaining the same posture, however she still wants to continue working and expanding her business by making skirts and blouses to stock her inventory.

This is her eleventh loan from MFP and she is counting on their collaboration in order to continue meeting her goals. She is also comfortable with her communal bank and considers its members to be responsible and supportive people. With the S/. 3,000 sum requested, she will purchase sewing supplies, such as fabric, elastic lace and other items, which she will bring from the capital, seeking the lowest prices by making high-volume purchases.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, elastic lace and other items.

loans.name: Reorita

texts.en:
Reorita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Reorita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Reorita would like to expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
Mercedez is 36 years old and married with two children. For the past six years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a restaurant. Mercedez has borrowed and repaid three previous loans through NWTF. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Mercedez is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Isomiddin

texts.ru:
Исомиддин уже несколько лет сотрудничает с нашей организацией. Он ответственный и целеустремленный человек. Исомиддин считает, что наши условия кредитования более приемлемы для него. Получив кредит он смог получить хорошую прибыль и улучшить свое финансовое положение, также он увеличил поголовья скота. Крупнорогатый скот, который у него имеется - это его богатство. 
Исомиддин на протяжении пяти лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном занимается купле-продажей крупного рогатого скота. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. У него имеется дехканское хозяйство, где он посеял холопок. 
Исомиддин просит кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en:
Isomiddin has been a client of MLO Humo & Partners for several years. He is a responsible and purposeful person. Isomiddin finds that MLO Humo's lending terms are quite acceptable. After receiving his previous loan, he was able to make higher profits and improve his financial situation, as well as increase the size of his herd. Isomiddin's cattle is his treasure.

Isomiddin has been raising livestock for the past five years, mainly buying and selling cattle. Additionally, he is engaged in agriculture on his farm where he has planted cotton. He is requesting this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia es la señora María Cleofe, ahora tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se sigue dedicando a la   ganadería, crianza de animales menores como cerdos, cuyes y ovejas, pero también se dedica a la agricultura, sembrado productos como papa, maíz y trigo según sea la estación. María Cleofe está solicitando el préstamo para comprar alimento como pastos, forraje, alfalfa etc. para sus animales.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. María Cleofe pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
María Cleofe quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, así que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en la educación de ellos.
texts.en: María Cleofe is now 35 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in Tambo Real in the province of Anta. She raises smaller animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, and sheep, and also grows crops such as potatoes, corn, and wheat, depending on the season. María Cleofe is requesting this loan to buy feed for her animals, including grass, hay, alfalfa, and so on. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her with her business and is committed to making her payments on time. María Cleofe belongs to the San Bartolo de Tambo Real village bank in Tambo Real, Anta Province, in Cusco, Peru.She wants to offer her children a better life and education. She makes sacrifices for them and hopes to work hard and save money to pay for their education.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals, including grass, hay, alfalfa, and so on.

loans.name: Jenny Jannet

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 27 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposo, con el cual tiene 2 niñas, de 6 años y la segunda de 6 meses, es una madre muy amorosa y sobre todo luchadora, ya que su primera niña nació que una discapacidad y debido a ello no pudo terminar de estudiar y se dedico de manera integra a su cuidado debido a su condición, por ello ella se esfuerza mucho junto a su esposo para poder darle a sus hijas una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura y también por su clima cálido y acogedor. 

Con mucho entusiasmo día a día Jenny atiende su pequeño negocio de venta d abarrotes, con el cual puede apoyar a su esposo con los gatos del hogar y los gastos de atención de su pequeña, diariamente puede llegar a atender hasta 20 clientes y ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Jenny está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas, entre otros; así de esta manera podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y también mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera ella podrá seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” poder darle una mejor calidad de vida y educación a sus hijas y llegar a tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Jenny is 27 years old and lives with her husband. They have two daughters, one six years old and the other six months old. She is a loving mother who fights for her children. Her elder daughter was born with a disability, so she was unable to finish her studies and instead took care of her daughter. She and her husband work hard to give their daughters a good life that is full of love. Her house is in Ica, an agricultural city with a warm, pleasant climate.

Every day Jenny puts a lot of enthusiasm into her little grocery shop, which allows her to help her husband with the household expenses and the cost of their daughter's health care. She gets up to 20 customers a day, and she thinks her business is going well because she's friendly with the customers and really wants to make it work.

Jenny is very grateful to Kiva's lenders, who have helped her buy merchandise for her business, including rice, sugar, pasta, jam, and other products that have allowed her to offer her customers a wider variety and to increase her earnings. That way, she can keep working every day to make her biggest dream—“to be able to give my daughters a better life and education and eventually open a minimarket”—come true.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, pasta, jam, etc.).

loans.name: Yanet Azucena

texts.es:
Yanet es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente desde hace varios años Yanet se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por la orilla de un río cercano a su hogar y  en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, Yanet puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella vende frituras, tales como: hamburguesas, alitas broaster, salchipapas, pollo broaster, entre otras; todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Yanet se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ella desea poder tarrajear, pintar y hacer pequeñas refacciones; de esta manera Yanet tendrá su hogar en mejores condiciones, brindando mayor seguridad y bienestar a su familia, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que poco a poco pueda ampliar su negocio y lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en: Yanet is 36 years old. She lives in the city of Camaná with her three children, who are the most important thing in her life. Unfortunately, Yanet and her partner split up a few years ago. Since then, she's done everything she can to improve her family's situation. She is very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic. In her free time, she likes to walk along the riverbank near her home and sometimes cooks a delicious lomo saltado (a Peruvian dish with steak and vegetables) for her family.With a lot of effort and her parents' help, Yanet has started a small business selling food. She sells fast foods such as hamburgers, chicken wings, hot dogs with potatoes, roasted chicken, and so on, starting very early every morning. She works about 12 hours a day and thinks her business is going well because of her hard work and friendly attitude with her customers.Yanet is very grateful for Kiva's lenders, who have helped her improve her home. She wants to plaster and paint her home and do some repairs so it will be in better shape and safer for her family. She will keep working and making an effort to gradually expand her business and achieve her greatest dream: seeing her children get good jobs and become upstanding men.

loans.use: to do repairs and maintenance on her home.

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es: Karla tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en una colonia Periférica de San Pedro Sula junto a sus 2 hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad. Karla es muy trabajadora y en busca de obtener ingresos para la manutención de sus hijos decidió hace dos años vender mercadería como ropa interior, blusas, pantalones, bisuterías, monederos, y otros que le soliciten. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y en su casa por pedidos. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar más mercadería que le han pedido sus clientes, así poder incrementar los ingresos. Su plan es continuar trabajando con ODEF y mantener un buen record crediticio.
texts.en: Karla is a 31 year-old single mother.  She lives in a neighborhood on the outskirts of San Pedro Sula along with her 2 children aged 2 and 4.  Karla is a very hardworking person, and she is seeking a way to earn income to support her children.  Two years ago, she decided to sell merchandise such as underwear, blouses, pants, accessories, wallets and other items that her customers request.  She sells from place to place, and she also takes orders in her home.  She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Honduran lempiras so that she can buy more merchandise that her customers have asked for.  This way she will be able to increase her income.  She plans to continue working with OFEF and to maintain a good credit record.

loans.use: to buy underwear, blouses, pants, handbags, wallets, and accessories to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Ana María, ahora tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se sigue dedicando a la   producción y venta  lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt y los comercializa en los mercados y ferias de su provincia. Ana María necesita más leche para elaborar sus productos, por ello invertirá su préstamo solicitado en  comprar una vaca lechera.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Ana María pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
Ana María quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, así que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en la educación de ellos.
texts.en: Ana María is now 33 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in Tambo Real, in the province of Anta, whre she produces and dairy products such as milk, cheese, and yogurt and sells them in the markets and shops in the region. Ana María needs more milk to make her products, so she will use the requested loan to buy a milk cow. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her with her business and is committed to making her payments on time. Ana María belongs to the San Bartolo de Tambo Real village bank in Tambo Real, Anta Province, in Cusco, Peru. Ana María wants to offer her children a better life and education. She makes sacrifices for them and hopes to work hard and save money to pay for their education.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
This is Evelina, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Elpidio, a taxi driver, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Evelina oversees the operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, her regular customers are from the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories, and also pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Evelina dreams to be successful in life and hopes to give her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their pedicab unit

loans.name: Aleja

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Aleja, ahora tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se dedica a la   agricultura, principalmente a la producción y venta de papa, trigo habas y quinua, además de esto, ella también se dedica a la a la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como cerdos, gallinas y cuyes.
Aleja invertirá su préstamo solicitado para comprar alimento como afrecho, forraje y chala para sus animales.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Aleja pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Aleja is now 37 years old. She is the single mother of two children. She lives in Tambo Real in the province of Anta. She raises crops, mainly potatoes, wheat, beans, and quinoa. She also raises small farm animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. Aleja will use the requested loan to buy feed for her animals, including mash, corn husks, and fodder. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her with her business and is committed to making her payments in full. Aleja belongs to the San Bartolo de Tambo Real village bank in Tambo Real, Anta Province, in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals, including mash, corn husks, and fodder.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
This is Pilar, 43, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Bartolome, her business partner, and mother to her children. Together with her husband, Pilar manages her household while operating her food stall. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and prepared food costs less than raw food. Pilar's regular customers are neighbors and local community members and she earns a minimum of 500 PHP each day. 

Pilar is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.  Pilar dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. Pilar faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.


Ingredients

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is married and runs a general store in the Philippines. She has run her business for the past ten years and works hard to support her family. 

Salvacion is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy grocery items such as shampoo, sugar, soft-drinks, and other products. In the future, she would like to save enough money to renovate her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, sugar, soft-drinks, and other items

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 29 years old married with five children, three of whom who are in school. For the past four years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Margie has borrowed three previous times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Margie is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Walter, el ahora tiene 44 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, Walter continua con su actividad económica principal que es la ganadería, pero también trabaja operando maquinaria pesada. Walter trabaja hace muchos años en esta actividad y es con esta que saca adelante a toda su familia.
Walter necesita mejorar la infraestructura de su establo, por ello invertirá su préstamo en la ampliación y mejoramiento de su fundo y su establo, para ello debe comprar materiales de construcción como madera y cemento, 
Walter está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo a mantenerse y desarrollarse en sus actividades y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Walter pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
Walter quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, así que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en la educación de ellos.
texts.en:
Walter, 44, is married and has two children. He lives in the Tambo Real District, Anta Province. He is continuing with his main job, which is ranching, but he also works operating heavy machinery. He has done with work for several years and this is how he is moving his family forward. Walter needs to improve his barn infrastructure, so he will invest the loan in enlarging and improving his farm and his barn. For this he needs to buy construction materials like wood and cement.

Walter is very thankful to Kiva for helping him to stay engaged and growing in his work and he promises to make his payments on time. Walter belongs to the communal bank San Bartolo de Tambo Real, in the Tambo Real District, Anta Province, in Cusco, Peru. He wants to provide a better life and education for his children, and he sacrifices for them. This is why he hopes to work a lot and save to invest in their education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Amia

texts.en:
Amia is a 55-year-old married woman with six children. For the past two years, she has been operating a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas to earn a living. Amia has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

Amia is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, bush knives, weed killer and spray, baby taros, a crow bar, and a chain saw. With her profits, she hopes to improve her business and help her family's living situation and provide for her kids' educations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killer, seedlings, and tools

loans.name: Munhnasan

texts.en:
Munhnasan lives with her husband and two children in an old house, in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband's name is Bathuyag.  He has found a new job and now works for a mining industry company. 

Munhnasan started her own sewing service business in 2004, so she now has eight years' experience in sewing service. Her business is sustainable and has many regular customers. The local residents describe her as an honest woman. 

Last year she bought old house, and she would now like to repair her house and to install new heating. Therefore she needs a 500,000 MNT loan to buy  a heating system and other construction materials to make repairs to her house.

loans.use: To purchase heating and other construction materials to make repairs to her house

loans.name: Abinery

texts.en:
Abinery is 32 years old.  He is married to Ruth, a business lady. Together they have two children.

He operates a motorcycle transport business, and he has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his second term loan in KADET LTD.  He was introduced to KADET by a credit officer.  He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. 

He will use the loan amount to purchase his motorcycle spare parts and also to service the motorcycle.  He hopes to purchase a chain of motorcycles.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Olevia

texts.en:
Olevia  is 19 years old and married, with one child. 

She wants to start a small  baking business, making and selling donuts, German buns, and biscuits in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, yeast, baking pans, oil, baking powder, and a new cooking oven set. 

In the future, Olevia hopes to improve her business to help her family matters and her kid educations. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, yeast, baking soda, and a new cooking oven..

loans.name: Daud

texts.en:
This year Daud got into the Nusantara Maritime Academy. He took the program of management and commercial shipping from ports. His father is long dead; he now lives with his mother and two brothers in a village in the Aru Islands, Maluku Tenggara, Indonesia. His mother works as a farmer and she is just amazing, but has very limited income, only enough for the needs of daily meals. As a single parent, his mother hopes Daud is getting his education for the future and will help his brothers. 

Due to his mother's expectations, Daud has ventured to ask for a loan from Kiva, to finance his education through to completion. He just wants to finish his education and become a professional employee at a port. Daud really hopes for the support of Kiva investors.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Ada Luz es una joven de 20 años de edad estudia la carrera de licenciatura en derecho, pagaba sus estudios con la ayuda brindada de su suegra. Solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación, de lo contrario no tendría otra alternativa que esperar hasta el próximo año para ver si hay recursos económicos y poder solventar. El ejercer su carrera para ella es muy importante porque es una forma de ingreso para su familia y ella, ya que también es trascendental en el ámbito jurídico de la nación, piensa que el apoyo de KIVA es muy importante para los jóvenes de baja posición económica a los que ayuda a culminar sus estudios, que es algo fundamental para progresar en la vida.
texts.en: Ada Luz is a young woman 20 years of age who is studying for her law degree. She was paying for her coursework with the help provided by her mother-in-law. She is seeking the loan in order to pay for licensing and registration requirements so that she may practice her profession; otherwise she would not have any other choice but to wait until next year to see whether there may be financial resources to cover it. Practicing her profession is very important to her because it is an income source for her and her family, and also is of far-reaching significance in the nation's legal field. She believes support from Kiva is very important for low-income young people whom it helps to culminate their studies, something which is fundamental to being able to progress in life.

loans.use: to pay for her official registration as a lawyer so that she may launch her new career.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a widowed mother of five children who works hard to support her family. She has a bamboo retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from making raffia. Lita has sustained her business through her previous three loans through NWTF.

Lita is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of bamboo to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La señora Justina, es socia del banco comunal “Virgen De La Natividad” del Distrito de Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 62 años de edad, es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.
Tiene 10 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y se dedica al alquiler de cuartos (habitaciones), las que mensualmente le generan ingresos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: un ciento de madera machimbrada, clavos, 6 listones dde madera, pintura, triplay.
Uno de sus hijos está viviendo en su casa, aunque ya es mayor de edad sigue acompañando a su mamá y al mismo tiempo ayudándole con su negocio el que más adelante  estará a su cargo.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos por todos los años que viene trabajando con los préstamos que le otorga.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the 'Virgen De La Natividad' community bank which is located in Coronel Portillo district, in Ucayali department.  She is 62 years old, single, and has four children.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos for ten years and her business is renting out rooms.

Justina will use her new loan for 2,000 soles to buy 100 pieces of lumber, nails, six wooden battens, paint and Triplay wood.  One of Justina's children lives at home with his mom even though he is an adult.  He helps her with her business and, in the future, he will be in charge of it.  Justina thanks Manuela Ramos for all the years she has been working with the loans they provide.

loans.use: to buy wood, wooden battens and paint

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La Srta. Yanet, tiene 24 años, es soltera. Ella está por finalizar sus estudios de danzas folkloricas, y dentro de muy poco iniciará sus trámites para la obtención de su titulo profesional como profesora de danzas folkloricas, para lo cual solicita el crédito. Actualmente, viene dictando clases por horas a escolares.
Su mayor motivación para salir adelante sus sus padres, quienes con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación la han apoyado para cumplir con una de sus metas la cual es terminar de estudiar. Le agrada mucho su carrera, desde muy pequeña le gustaba mucho bailar, participar en las actuaciones del colegio donde estudiaban inclinándose desde ya a las danzas folkloricas.
En la fotografía la vemos en su ceremonia de graduación.
texts.en:
Yanet is 24 years old and is single. She is about to finish her studies in Folkloric Dance and very soon she will start the process to obtain her degree as a Teacher of Folkloric Dance, which is why she is requesting this loan. Currently, she is teaching classes at schools for hours.

Her biggest motivation to get ahead are her parents, who with a lot of effort and dedication have supported her in achieving one of her goals which is to finish her studies. She likes her career a lot. Since she was a child she really liked to dance, especially in school performances where she studied, leaning towards folkloric dance.

In the photograph we see her at her graduation ceremony.

loans.use: to invest in obtaining her degree as a teacher in folkloric dance.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
La señora Felicita es socia del banco comunal “las Margaritas”, del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.
Tiene muy poco tiempo trabajando con los préstamos que Manuela Ramos le da cada ciclo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 comprará: 10 pantalones, 10 camisas, 20 polos para adultos, 5 chompas, 7 camisas manga larga.
Su ropa lo vende por las chacras, es donde tiene a sus clientes y los visita cada quincena llevando las novedades, gracias a Manuela Ramos tiene este pequeño negocio  que le ayuda a generar ingresos para su hogar porque es la única que ve por la crianza de sus hijos quienes todavía dependen de ella.
texts.en:
Ms. Felicita is a member of the communal bank "Las Margaritas" of the Coronel Portillo district, department of Ucayali. She is 46 years old, single and has four children. She has been working only a short time with the loans which Manuela Ramos gives her each loan cycle. She earns a living selling secondhand clothing. 

With the new loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles she will purchase 10 pairs of pants, 10 shirts, 20 polo shirts for adults, 5 sweaters, and 7 long-sleeved shirts.
 
She sells her clothing at farmhouses where she has her customers. She visits them every two weeks bringing them what's new. Thanks to Manuela Ramos she has this small business which helps her generate income for her home because she is the only one raising her children, who still depend on her.

loans.use: to purchase polo shirts, pants, etc. for her used clothing business.

loans.name: Chak's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Sangke district of Battambang province, Chak is 63 years, married, and a mother of eight, two of whom are staying with the family and working for others. Chak has been farming rice for thirty five years, earning about 4,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Low crop yield is still the main challenge for her paddy rice business.

Chak has received three previous loans from VisionFund, all of which have helped to relieve the family’s burden in terms of spending on daily foods and other expenses. Now leading a group of three female members who live in the same village requesting a new loan from VisionFund, Chak will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income from the rice crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
La señora Charito es socia del banco comunal “Las Margaritas” del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Se dedica a la venta de comidas, tiene un local en el centro de la ciudad donde realiza sus actividades desde muy temprano, en horas de la tarde hace sus comparas para poder tener todo lista.
Con su nuevo préstamo  S/.  1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: utensilios de cocina como son: 1 espumadera, 2 cucharones, 3 cuchillos, 3 tazones, 2 coladores, 1 tenedor grande, un juego de cernidores, manteles, saleras.
Está tratando de mejorar su local todavía le faltan algunas cosas pero más adelante se encargara de eso, por lo pronto está dedicada a dar una buena atención a sus clientas para que se sientan a gusto, agradece a  Manuela Ramos por darle el apoyo económico  y también por las charlas educativas que las promotoras les imparten.
texts.en:
