Charito is a member of the 'Las Margaritas' community bank which is located in Coronel Portillo district, in Ucayali department.  She is 37 years old, married, and has one son.

Charito's business is selling food.  She has premises in the city center where she carries out her work from very early in the morning.  She does her shopping in the afternoon so that she has everything ready.

Charito will use her new loan for 1,000 soles to buy cooking utensils.  She will buy 1 skimmer, 2 ladles, 3 knives, 3 bowls, 2 colanders, 1 large fork, a set of sieves, tablecloths and salt shakers.

Charito is trying to improve her business premises.  She still needs some things but she will take care of that later.  For now, she is committed to providing her customers with a good service so that they feel happy.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her financial support and also for the educational talks that the loan officers give.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils

loans.name: Kitiana

texts.en:
Kitiana is a 46-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taamu (giant taro), yams, bananas and umala (sweet potato) to earn a living. She has been doing this for a year.

Kitiana is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, a mist blower, spades, tool sharpeners and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

With her profits, Kitiana hopes to help improve her business, help with her family's matters and her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicide, a mist blower, spades, a wheelbarrow etc.

loans.name: Leata

texts.en:
Leata  is 38 years old and married, with three children. 

She wants to start a small bakery business, making and selling pork buns, donuts, cream buns, German buns, and biscuits in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, salt, yeast, baking powder, pork meat, sugar, and oil. 

In the future, Leata hopes to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy flour, salt, yeast, baking soda, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ekan

texts.en:
Ekan, at the moment, is one of the students studying management commerce and harbor administration at the Nusantara Maritime Academy. She wants to be a reliable and professional employee at a large harbor office. 

Ekan’s parents are just small merchants; they tried to make every effort to assist Ekan to achieve her goals. However, the current economic conditions of her parents are declining, and Ekan is confused about how to continue her studies. Ekan is hoping to get a loan from Kiva to help finance her studies and to ease the burden on her parents. Ekan is extremely grateful to the lenders because she will be able to continue her studies, though they do not personally know each other.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Celina Yaneth

texts.es:
Celina es una joven de 28 años de edad, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar vóley con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Gastronomía ya que le encanta cocinar, asimismo Celina vive al lado de una tía, a la cual quiere mucho y a la que apoya con el fruto de su trabajo.

Día a día Celina trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de pollo broster, hamburguesa, así como también vende ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo tiene muy buena sazón para la preparación de sus platillos.

Celina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a ala ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una mesa y sillas para su negocio de venta de broster y también comprara ropa para su negocio de venta de ropa, con lo cual podrá ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes y mayor variedad de productos, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Celina is 28 years old and lives in the city of Pisco, which is characterized by its warm and welcoming environment. There is also agriculture, especially of cotton and corn, among other crops. When she has free time, she really like to play volleyball with her friends and neighbors. She also loves to eat one of her favorite dishes: Ají de gallina (a traditional chicken stew). Due to her few economic resources, she was only able to study up to the fifth level of secondary school, but she would have liked to study gastronomy because she loves to cook. Celina lives next to her aunt, who she loves very much, and who she supports with the fruits of her labor.

Day after day, Celina works in her small business, selling fried chicken and hamburgers. She also sells men's, women's, and children's clothing. She works around 10 hours a day and can see up to 25 customers a day. She believes the business is going very well for her because she is very nice and her dishes are very well seasoned.

Celina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to buy a table and chairs for her food business and she will also buy clothes for her clothing business. She will be able to offer greater comfort to her customers and a larger variety of products, which will allow her to increase her income and continue fighting to make her greatest dream a reality: having her own home.

loans.use: to buy a table, chairs, and clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
ROSA
La señora Rosa, es socia del banco comunal  “Las Margaritas”. Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.
Recién tiene 6 ciclos trabajando con los préstamos que le ha servido para seguir surtiendo la bodega que tiene en su casa, recibe la ayuda de sus hijos para la atención a los clientes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprara: 4 paquetes de gaseosas, 3 paquetes de agua mineral,  2 paquetes de guaraná,  4 paquetes de gaseosa de 2 litros, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, una caja de leche.
Con el ingreso que obtiene de  su negocio puede pagar todos meses las cuotas a Manuela Ramos para no tener problemas que le perjudicarían, está contenta con su negocio  porque cada día está creciendo de esa manera le va generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
ROSA

Rosa’s a member of the “Las Margaritas” (The Daisies) communal bank in Coronel Portillo District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 50-years-old, married and has two children.

She’s been working with loans for six cycles; they’ve helped her stock her home-based store.  Her children help her take care of customers.

She will use her current, 1500 new sol loan to buy four packages of soft-drinks, 3 packages of mineral water, 2 packages of guaraná [brand of soft-drink], four packages of soft-drinks, one sack of sugar, a sack of rice and a case of milk.

With income she earns from her store she will be able to make her monthly payments to Manuela Ramos so that she won’t have any problems that could damage her reputation.  She’s happy with her business because it’s growing every day and it will generate more income for her that way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en:
Tserendolgor is 46 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger (a traditional Mongolian housing tent), in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband's name is Jargalsaihan. He is 49 years old and unemployed. Her oldest daughter is a college student, two of her daughters are secondary school students and the youngest stays at home. 

She started her business in 2000, and her main products are various covering materials for a Mongolian yurt. Prior to this, she had a home-based sewing business. 

Since 2005, Tserendolgor has been selling her products from a rented room in a "business development center" of Uvurhangai province. She is well-experienced in this sector, with many years in the sewing business, and has many regular suppliers and customers. The local residents identify her as an honest and hardworking woman. 

Tserendolgor is requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan. With half the loan she wants to pay for her daughter's tuition fees and with the rest she will purchase raw materials for her sewing business. She says "My efficiency and profit will increase with this investment in the business and this will improve my life".

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her sewing business and to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Kristel Kimberli

texts.es:
Kristel es una joven muy entusiasta y trabajadora, ella vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, sus hermosas playas y sus exquisitos camarones; por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Chupe de Camarones”; es madre de un pequeño de 2 años al que ama muchísimo y es el motor de su vida, por ello ella trabaja muy duro para sacarlo adelante y para que sea mejor que ella; Kristel solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto año de secundaria  pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.

Con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos; ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 12 horas diarias, le gusta su trabajo y por ello se levanta muy temprano para limpiar el lugar donde comen y viven los cerditos, asi como también alimentarlos; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio debido a que es muy amable con los clientes y cría a los animales de manera adecuada y por ello los clientes tienen confianza en lo que Kristel ofrece.

Kristel está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran apoyo y gracias a ello podra comprar alimento para su cerdos como polvillos, afrecho, entre otros y con ello podrá aumentar sus ingresos para seguir luchando cada día para cumplir su gran sueño.” Seguir creciendo en su negocio y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Kristel is a very enthusiastic and hard-working young woman. She lives in Camaná, a city characterized by its hot climate, beautiful beaches, and exquisite shrimp. Because of this, one of her favorite dishes is the delicious Chupe de Camarones (a Peruvian shrimp chowder). She has a 2-year-old son whom she loves very much and he is the driving force in her life. She works very hard to move him forward and so that he can be better off than her. Kristel could only study up through the fifth level of secondary school, but she would have liked to study nursing.

She got her business raising and selling pigs with a lot of effort. She dedicates about 12 hours a day to her work. She likes her work and she wakes up very early to clean the place where the piglets live and eat, and also to feed them. She believes the business is going well for her because she is very friendly to her customers and raises the animals properly, and for this reason, her customers have confidence in what she offers.

Kristel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because this is the second time that they have helped her and thanks to this, she will be able to buy food for her pigs, like rice-based feed and bran among others. She will be able to increase her income in order to keep fighting everyday for her greatest dream: keep growing her business and give her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 35 years old, married to Richard and blessed with four children aged 11, 10, 5 and 1 year. She has been in the business of baking and selling snacks for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 50,000.

Anne has requested her second loans of KES. 60,000 to purchase an oven for baking and to pay rent for new and bigger business premises. The profit she earns will be ploughed back to her business. She dreams of opening a big bakery in the region.

loans.use: to purchase an oven for baking and to pay rent for new and bigger business premises.

loans.name: Aura Manuelita

texts.es:
La señora Aura es socia del banco comunal “Santa Bárbara”. Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Son varios los años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y tiene una mueblería donde trabaja todo el día, pero cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo y de su nuera, porque cuando llegan los clientes les falta personal para atender porque a veces tiene que ir a su almacén para sacar los muebles y alguien tiene que darse en su tienda.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 10 mesas en blanco, 10 camarotes, 6 camas de dos plazas, 10 camas de una plaza, 50taburetes, 2 cómodas, 2 galones de laca, 2 kilos de guaipe. 
Con este negocio  tiene buenas ganancias y todo lo sigue invirtiendo para tener toda clase de muebles y brindar una buena atención a sus clientes, le gusta lo que hace y dedica todo su tiempo para que las cosas estén bien, su esposo es jubilado y le da mucho gusto que su esposa tenga su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Aura’s a member of the “Santa Bárbara” communal bank in Coronel Portillo District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 62-years-old, married and has three children.  She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for many years and she owns a furniture store where she works all day.  
Her son and daughter-in-law help her, though, because when customers come by she does not have staff to take care of them when she has to go to the warehouse to get the furniture; someone has to stay at the store.


She will use her 3000 new sol loan to buy ten unfinished tables, ten cots, six double beds, ten single beds, 50 stools, 2 armoires, 2 gallons of lacquer and 2 kilos of cleaning rags.


This business produces good profits and she reinvests all of them in order to have all kinds of furniture and provide good customers service.  She likes what she does and focuses all her time into seeing that things are done well.  Her husband’s retired and it makes him very happy that his wife has her own business.

loans.use: to buy furniture and furniture-making supplies.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.es:
La señora Leonila, es socia del banco comunal “Las Margaritas”. Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Lleva tres años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, su esposo es trabajador independiente y es el que mantiene el hogar.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprara; 3 juegos de collares, 2 perfumes para damas, 3 perfumes para caballero, 2 cremas para manos, 3 labiales, 2 colonias que están en oferta.
Estos son los productos que los tienen en su vitrina para ofrecer a sus clientas, también los vende a crédito para que le paguen en partes, les brinda todas la facilidades del caso, gracias a Manuela Ramos puede tener el dinero para comprar sus productos y poder obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Leonila’s a member of the “Las Margaritas” (The Daisies) communal bank in Coronel Portillo District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 36-years-old, married and has three children.  She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for three years.  She sells products via catalogue and her husband works independently and supports their home.  


She will use the 1500 new sol loan to buy three sets of necklaces, two women’s perfumes, three perfumes for men, two hand creams, three lipsticks and two colognes that are on special.  These are the products she has on display to offer her customers.  She sells on credit and collects payments; she gives them all the necessary payment options.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos she’s able to have money to buy the products and earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Luis Alcides

texts.es:
Luis tiene 45 años y es divorciado, terminó la primaria, pero no tuvo los recursos para continuar sus estudios; vive con su joven hijo de 13 años quien se encuentra cursando la secundaria. Ellos viven en el Recinto Bellavista un sector de clima húmedo de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas,  una provincia clave en la comunicación comercial de las regiones Costa y Sierra de la República del Ecuador. Su economía se ha desarrollado gracias a las actividades de turismo, comercio, agricultura y ganadería. 
En esta provincia de grandes oportunidades de emprendimiento, comienza Luis su negocio de producción de leche hace 12 años, al cual invierte muchas horas de arduo trabajo cada día de la semana. Luis acudió a Fundación Alternativa porque se enteró del apoyo que brinda al sector rural y  decidió solicitar un crédito que lo destinará a comprar ganado y de esta forma aumentar la producción de leche que distribuye en los alrededores del Recinto. Luis espera darle a su hijo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta que obtenga una profesión y está seguro que siempre será firme en su meta a pesar de los obstáculos que se le presentan cuando los animales se enferman, y le generan pérdidas.
texts.en:
Luis, 45, is divorced.  He completed elementary school but did not have the resources needed to continue with his education.  He lives with his 13-year-old son who is attending secondary school.  They live in Recinto Bellavista, a sector with humid climate in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province, a key province where the coastal and mountain regions of Ecuador meet.  Its economy has developed thanks to tourism, commerce, agriculture and animal husbandry.

Luis started his milk business in this province with great opportunities for entrepreneurship 12 years ago.  He spends long hours of hard work at it every day of the week.  Luis approached Fundación Alternativa to request a loan to buy cattle to increase the production of milk that he sells locally.  Luis hopes to give his son the opportunity of studying a profession and he’s sure that he’ll stay firm towards his goals despite obstacles that arise when his animals get sick and losses are incurred.

loans.use: to acquire cattle and increase milk production.

loans.name: Geovanny Victor

texts.es:
Geovanny es un joven de 19 años,  soltero, terminó la primaria, pero no tuvo los recursos para continuar sus estudios; vive con su madre y hermanos. Ellos viven en el Recinto Bellavista un sector de clima húmedo de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas,  una provincia clave en la comunicación comercial de las regiones Costa y Sierra de la República del Ecuador. Su economía se ha desarrollado gracias a las actividades de turismo, comercio, agricultura y ganadería. 
Geovanny comenzó su negocio de producción de leche hace 5 años, al cual invierte muchas horas de arduo trabajo cada día de la semana. Geovanny  acudió a Fundación Alternativa porque se enteró del apoyo que brinda al sector rural y  decidió solicitar un crédito que lo destinará a comprar ganado y de esta forma aumentar la producción de leche que distribuye en los alrededores del Recinto.
texts.en:
Geovanny, 19, is single.  He completed elementary school but did not have the resources needed to continue with his education.  He lives with his mother and siblings.  They live in Recinto Bellavista, a sector with humid climate in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province, a key province where the coastal and mountain regions of Ecuador meet.  Its economy has developed thanks to tourism, commerce, agriculture and animal husbandry.

Geovanny started his milk producing business five years ago.  He puts long hours of hard work into it every day of the week.  Geovanny approached Fundación Alternativa because he found out about the the support it gives the rural sector and he decided to request a loan to buy cattle to increase production of milk he sells locally.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta is a 32 year old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation where she grows peanuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 1 year, and has requested a loan to buy necessary equipment such as chemicals, shovels, a hose, a wheel barrow, plastic bags, peanut seeds, & spades. Imeleta has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, she hopes to improve her business to help her family and educate her kids.

loans.use: to buy necessary equipment such as chemicals, shovels, a hose, a wheel barrow, plastic bags, peanut seeds, & spades.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer  joven de 20 años,  soltera, terminó la primaria, pero no tuvo los recursos para continuar sus estudios; vive con su madre. Ellas viven en el Recinto Bellavista un sector de clima húmedo de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas,  una provincia clave en la comunicación comercial de las regiones Costa y Sierra de la República del Ecuador. Su economía se ha desarrollado gracias a las actividades de turismo, comercio, agricultura y ganadería. 
Diana comenzó su negocio de producción de leche hace 4 años, al cual invierte muchas horas de arduo trabajo cada día de la semana. Diana  acudió a Fundación Alternativa porque se enteró del apoyo que brinda al sector rural y  decidió solicitar un crédito que lo destinará a comprar ganado y de esta forma aumentar la producción de leche que distribuye en los alrededores del Recinto.
texts.en:
Diana, 20, is single.  She completed elementary school but did not have the resources needed to continue with her education.  She lives with her mother.  They live in Recinto Bellavista, a sector with humid climate in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province, a key province where the coastal and mountain regions of Ecuador meet.  Its economy has developed thanks to tourism, commerce, agriculture and animal husbandry.

Diana started her milk producing business four years ago.  She puts long hours of hard work into it every day of the week.  Diana approached Fundación Alternativa because she found out about the the support it gives the rural sector and she decided to request a loan to buy cattle to increase production of milk she sells locally.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз 30 - летняя женщина проживающая в городе Куляб. Она замужем, мать троих детей. Ее муж уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Сама Дилафруз у себя дома предоставляет услугу. Она портниха. Дилафруз на протяжении 16 лет занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она просит кредит для ремонта своего дома, чтобы расширить место деятельности. Также она хочет приобрести специальную вешалку, новый утюг и большой стол.
texts.en: Dilafruz is 30 years old and lives in the city of Kulob.  She is married and is the mother of three children.  Her husband has left to work in the Russian Federation.  Dilafruz works from home as a seamstress and she has been sewing national costumes for over 16 years.  She is asking for a loan to make repairs on her home so she can expand her workspace.  She would also like to buy hangers, a new iron and a big table.

loans.use: to repair her home and to buy hangers, an iron and a table

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 69 años, casado y es analfabeto, vive con su esposa y su joven hijo quien se encuentra cursando la secundaria. Ellos viven en el Recinto Bellavista un sector de clima húmedo de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas,  una provincia clave en la comunicación comercial de las regiones Costa y Sierra de la República del Ecuador. Su economía se ha desarrollado gracias a las actividades de turismo, comercio, agricultura y ganadería. 
Manuel trabaja en una finca, en donde emprendió  su negocio de producción de leche hace 28 años, en donde invierte muchas horas de arduo trabajo cada día de la semana al igual que su esposa. Manuel acudió a Fundación Alternativa porque se enteró del apoyo que brinda al sector rural y  decidió solicitar un crédito que lo destinará a comprar ganado y de esta forma aumentar la producción de leche que distribuye en los alrededores del Recinto. Manuel espera darle a su hijo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta que obtenga una profesión y está seguro que siempre será firme en su meta.
texts.en:
Manuel, 69, is married and illiterate.  He lives with his wife and a young son who attends secondary school.  They live in Recinto Bellavista, a sector with humid climate in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province, a key province where the coastal and mountain regions of Ecuador meet.  Its economy has developed thanks to tourism, commerce, agriculture and animal husbandry.

Manuel works on a farm where he learned the milk-producing business 28 years ago.  He puts long hours of hard work into it every day of the week as does his wife.  Manuel approached Fundación Alternativa because he found out about the the support it gives the rural sector and he decided to request a loan to buy cattle to increase production of milk she sells locally.  Manuel hopes to provide his son with the opportunity of attaining a profession and he’s sure that he will remain steadfast to his goal.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Maria Elena, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y tiene 1 hija,  vive en el distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia se dedica al comercio de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes, pero también esta incursionando en el negocio de venta de gas domestico y comenta que le está yendo muy bien. Maria Elena necesita más capital para levantar el comercio de gas, por ello solicita el préstamo para comprar balones de Gas.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Maria Elena pertenece al banco comunal “Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
Maria Elena está trabajando mucho para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hija, y para ella es todo su sacrificio.
texts.en:
María Elena, 22, is married and has a daughter; she lives in the city of Cusco’s Santiago district.  She sells basic staple items in her grocery store but is also starting to go into the business of selling gas for domestic use and she comments that she’s doing very well.  María Elena needs more capital to get the gas business going so is asking for a loan to buy tanks of gas.

She is very grateful to KIVA for helping her develop in her activity and commits to make her installment payments punctually.  María Elena belongs to the “Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago” (Path to Success-Santiago) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  María Elena is working hard to provide a better future for her daughter and this is quite a struggle for her.

loans.use: to buy tanks fo gas.

loans.name: Felicidad Maria

texts.es: La cliente Felicidad tiene 34 años de edad,  ella se dedica al comercio ambulante (venta de DVD, Memorias, cargadores de celular, audífonos) casada con el señor Ramiro quien es mensajero de una institución privada,  La pareja no tiene niños por el momento, pero su deseo en un futuro es tener familia, viven en casa del suegro de la Sra. felicidad ubicado en la zona de alto Escobar,  El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como ser lector blueray,  dvd´s , flash memory´s y cargadores de celular al por mayor ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien invirtiendo en mercadería ya que es el comercio principal  que tiene la cliente y quiere abastecerse de mercadería ya que está creciendo en su negocio, su deseo de la Sra. felicidad es tener su puesto fijo y surtir de mercadería, la Sra. felicidad es un apersona muy trabajadora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Felicidad is 34 years old and is a traveling saleswoman (she sells DVDs, memory sticks, cell phone chargers and earphones). She is married to Ramiro, who is a messenger with a private agency. The couple does not have children at the moment, but their desire is to have a family in the future. They live in her father-in-law’s home in the Upper Escobar area.

Felicidad is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as Blu-ray readers, DVDs, flash drives, and cell phone chargers wholesale.  

Her previous loan went very well for her by investing in merchandise, which is her primary business.  She wants to stock up on merchandise because her business is growing.  Felicidad wishes to have a fixed stand and to stock up on merchandise.

Felicidad is a very hard-working person, and she is grateful to the institution for the support given to her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as Blu-ray readers, DVDs, flash drives, and cell phone chargers

loans.name: Rosa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador se encuentra Santo Domingo, una ciudad que se ha convertido en un eje comercial con varios sectores en crecimiento y como prueba se tiene a varias familias emprendedoras que hace algunos años comenzaron con pequeños negocios y ahora son microempresarios que aportan a la generación de empleo. Los estudios revelan que todos los negocios en su mayoría, empezaron empíricamente y han tenido acogida por el paso de turistas, empresarios y viajeros que se trasladan de una región a otra y además que es la tercera ciudad más habitada en el país. De esta generación de emprendedores surge Rosa, una mujer de 39 años, divorciada con dos hijos de siete y trece años, terminó la secundaria.
Rosa trabaja actualmente vendiendo ropa y cosméticos, negocio al que le dedica seis horas cada día desde hace seis años. Solicita un crédito para comprar ropa y artículos de belleza para poder mejorar la oferta a sus clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y además tener un ahorro que le permita cumplir su sueño de establecer un local en el sector comercial de la ciudad.Ella agradece a Fundación Alternativa por la oportunidad que le brinda para avanzar con este proyecto.
texts.en:
Connecting the mountain region to the coastal region of Ecuador one finds Santo Domingo, a city that has been converted into a commercial hub with several growth sectors. As proof, there are various enterprising families who began some years ago with small businesses and who are now microentrepreneurs who contribute to the generation of employment. Studies reveal that majority of businesses began empirically and were welcomed by the passing of tourists, businesspeople, and travelers that move from one region to the other. Furthermore, it is the third most populous city in the country. From this generation of entrepreneurs comes Rosa, a 39-year-old divorcee who finished secondary school with two children aged seven and thirteen.

Rosa currently works selling clothes and cosmetics, a business to which she has dedicated six hours each day for six years. She is requesting this loan to buy clothing and beauty products to be able to improve the supply for her customers and so improve her and her family’s quality of life and furthermore have savings that allow her to achieve her dream of establishing a store in the commercial sector of the city. She thanks Fundación Alternativa for the opportunity that it is providing her to advance with this project.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Tedy

texts.en:
Tedy comes from the interior of the island of Borneo, precisely the village of Landau Panjang, Indonesia. He wanders alone to leave his parents and two brothers, to study management and harbor cruise commerce at Nusantara Maritime Academy, on the island of Java, in the city of Cilacap. The distance from his native village to the town of Cilacap is very far; he had to cross the sea of Java, which takes one to two days. 

The expectation of his parents is that in order to learn, Tedy will be diligent and quickly complete college. His parents made all of their efforts to help Tedy to get his dream, even though they are just rubber workers. Their income is uncertain because the weather is less friendly to the rubber workers. Tedy is very saddened by the condition of his parents, so he is determined to finish his studies quickly. He hopes, with a loan from Kiva investors, he can help overcome these difficulties. Tedy hope to quickly get a job at a shipping company.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Cecilia Gertrudes

texts.es:
Cecila tiene 38 años es madre soltera y tiene un niño que está en una Escuela fiscal. Cecilia se considera una mujer luchadora ya que ella busca la forma de subsistir en esta tan vida difícil para darle una mejor vida a su hijo.
Ella empezó a realizar  actividades de ventas de comida, ventas de productos cosméticos y un hermano le dio la idea de reciclar, cartones, papeles, botellas, poco a poco ella comenzó el negocio de reciclaje. En la actualidad es esta su actividad que le genera ingresos. 
Con el préstamo va a comprar sacos y materiales para poder reciclar y así vender más rápidamente los cartones, papeles, botellas. El sueño es construir una vivienda en lote vacio para obtener su propio activo.
texts.en:
Cecila, age 38, is a single mother.  She has a son who goes to public school.  Cecilia is considered to be a tenacious woman.  She seeks a way to survive in this very difficult life in order to give her son a better life.

She started by doing the business activities of selling food and selling cosmetic products.  Her brother gave her the idea of recycling cardboard, paper, and bottles.  Little by little she started the recycling business.

This business activity is currently what generates income for her.  She will use the loan to buy sacks and materials in order to be able to recycle.  This way she will sell the cardboard, paper and bottles more quickly.

Her dream is to build a house on an empty lot in order to get her own property.

loans.use: to buy sacks and materials in order to be able to recycle.

loans.name: Claudina Nieve

texts.es:
Claudina esta casada y sus hijos son mayores de edad, es una mujer emprendedora ya que aprendió a confeccionar zapatilla porque una amiga le enseño. 
Ella se  dedico a la venta de zapatilla  hace 8 años con este negocio junto con su hija  pero ella se caso y ahora trabaja sola.
Claudina trabaja todo el día, incluso en ocasiones se amanece trabajando  para hacer mas zapatillas y tener lo suficiente para vender a sus clientes. Su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañearía, y soldadura.
Una de las dificultades serian que le roben su local, ya que donde vive es una zona peligrosa, por lo cual  ella ha tomado todas las precauciones posibles para tener las seguridades en su negocio. Quiere comprar con el préstamo cuero, hilos, maniguetas para elaborar las zapatillas.  El sueño es tener un local grande y bien establecido estar junto a su esposo y mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Claudina’s married and her children are all adults.  She’s an enterprising woman who learned from a girlfriend how to manufacture slippers.  She started selling slippers 8 years ago with her and her daughter but now she got married so she now works alone.

Claudina works all day; sometimes she stays up all night working in order make more slippers and have enough to sell to her customers.  Her husband works as an assistant in construction and welding.

One of her difficulties would be if her store were to be robbed because she lives in a dangerous zone but she’s taken all possible precautions to be safe at work.  She wants to use the loan to buy leather, thread and clasps to make the slippers.  Her dream is to have a large, well established locale, to stay together with her husband and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread, clasps.

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Ruth, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, vive en el distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia trabaja como camarera en un hotel, pero también se dedica a la fabricación de joyas en plata y pedrería. Ruth necesita aumentar la producción de sus joyas,  para cumplir con las solicitudes de los clientes, por ello solicita el préstamo para comprar plata.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Ruth pertenece al banco comunal “Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
Ruth está trabajando mucho para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, 2 de los cuales en edad escolar,  y para ella es todo su sacrificio.
texts.en: Ruth, 37, is married and has two children.  She lives in the city of Cusco’s Santiago district.  She works as a hotel housekeeper but also manufactures silver and stoneware jewelry.  Ruth needs to increase her jewelry production to fill customer orders which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy silver.  She’s very grateful to KIVA for helping her develop in her activity and she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She belongs to the “Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago” communal bank in Cusco, Peru.  Ruth is working hard to provide a better future for her children who are school age and this is quite a struggle for her.

loans.use: to buy silver.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Lucila, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre de  4 hijos,  vive en el distrito Santiago del Cusco, la socia se dedica a la   elaboración y venta de alimentos, en la modalidad de refrigerios, y los comercializa en una institución educativa privada.
Lucila invertirá su préstamo solicitado para comprar una computadora para su hijo menor, el cual acaba de ingresar a la universidad.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla en la educación de su hijo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Lucila, 55, is the mother of four children.  She lives in Santiago del Cusco district.  She makes snack food to sell in a private school.  Lucila will use the requested loan to buy her youngest son a computer; he’s just recently started university.  She is very grateful to KIVA for helping with her son’s education.  She belongs to the “Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago” communal bank in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy her son a computer.

loans.name: Los Apachetas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Los Apachetas” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de queso, venta de cuchufli, venta de ropa, venta de volantines, fletes, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Patricia presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta de color café, un gorro de color beige, y en sus piernas está sentada su nieta.
Ella se dedica al rubro de ventas de provisiones, desde hace 8 meses. Comenta que trabaja en conjunto con las personas del grupo del Banco Comunal, su horario de trabajo es todos los días, desde las 8ºº hasta las 22ºº horas, su negocio lo ubica cerca de su casa.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en diferentes supermercados, distribuidoras y ferias a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará lentejas, azúcar, arroz, aceite, papas fritas, dulces, cuadernos, tijeras, pegamento, ropa interior, para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Patricia es poder agrandar su local, hacerlo más llamativo para atraer más clientela, ya que vende de todo.
Patricia vive junto a sus 2 hijos de 26 y 25 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es poder ser dueña de las maquinarias que utiliza en su negocio ya que las arrienda (maquina cortadora de cecina, maquina congeladora), y a nivel familiar brindarle a su familia un buen pasar.
Ella esta muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Los Apachetas” and it has 17 entrepreneurs who carry out a variety of businesses, among which are cheese sales, ‘cuchufli’ [traditional Chilean candy] sales, clothing sales, kite sales, shipping services and other services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Temuco.

Patricia is the president of this communal bank and in the photo is seated in the first row, second from right to left, wearing a brown jacket, beige cap; her granddaughter is in her lap.

She has been selling groceries for 8 months.  She comments that she works together with people form the communal bank.  She works every day from 8am until 10pm and her store is located near her house.  She buys the things she needs in various supermarkets, supply centers and low-cost street markets which is advantageous economically.  She will use the loan to buy lentils, sugar, rice, oil, fried potatoes, candy, notebooks, scissors, glue and underwear to stock her store.  One of Patricia’s goals it to be able to enlarge her store to make it more eye-catching and attract more customers since she sells everything.

Patricia lives with her two children who are 26 and 25 years of age.  Her work-related dream is to own the machines she uses in her business that she currently leases (meat slicer, freezer) and her goals for her family is to provide them with wellbeing.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her because she’ll be able to invest in her business.  With respect to the communal bank she’s a member of, she comments that there is very good communication among them.  On the other hand, the training has taught her new sales and bookkeeping strategies.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía Region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (Capital of Chile).  There are several lakeside resorts nearby (Pucón and Villarrica) and it has very flamboyant native flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.  It’s important to point out that 50% of the native Mapuche, indigenous people of Chile, live here.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Ada Gabriela

texts.es: La joven Ada Gabriela es estudiante de la carrera de ingeniería en sistemas quien obtiene sus estudios por medio de becas y apoyo de sus padres, no ha tenido ningún obstáculo  en seguir adelante con sus estudios. Ahora solicita este crédito para pagar el curso de titulación, ya que de no ser posible tendría que esperar hasta encontrar un empleo para poder pagarlo.  Ada Gabriela, le apasionan las computadoras y ella piensa que sería un beneficio muy grande para su familia el seguir adelante con su carrera de sistemas y obtener un buen trabajo donde  desempeñe todos sus conocimientos adquiridos. Agradece a KIVA y AFODENIC el apoyo que brindan para que los jóvenes que estudian puedan culminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Ada Gabriela is a systems engineering student who is able to pursue her studies thanks to scholarships and support from her parents. She had no obstacles in her studies.  She’s asking for a loan now to pay the fees associated with the final course required for her degree because without it she’d have to wait until she got a job to be able to pay for it.

Ada Gabriela is fascinated by computers and she thinks that it would be a great benefit for her family for her to continue with her systems career so that she can get a good job where she can apply all the knowledge she’s acquired.  She thanks KIVA and AFODENIC for the support they give young people who are studying so that they can finish their careers.

loans.use: to pay final course fees.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser cordial y amable.  Es separada del padre de su hijo Collin de 4 años de edad.  Vive en compañía de su hermano y su hijo, a quienes quiere mucho, habitando su propia casa. La actividad que realizaba Jackeline es la venta de comidas como menús durante el día, negocio que realizaba en el frontis de su casa e iniciándose con préstamo de MFP, instalaba todos los días una mesa en el frontis de su casa,  donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. Se inició hace 04 años contando con el apoyo de una señorita quien es  ayudante y le pagaba 50 nuevos soles semanales.
Suspendió temporalmente éste negocio por que logró conseguir un empleo de docente de firmando contrato, esto le permitirá contar con un ingreso constante.
Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones económicas y personales ya que cuando tenia muchos apuros económicos ya que la pensión que le pasa el padre de su hijo no le alcanzaba y viendo la necesidad que tenía se decidió iniciar su negocio, y viendo que le resultaba rentable continuó con ésta actividad. Ahora viendo la oportunidad que le brinda de contar con un empleo y espera poder darse tiempo para retomar  su negocio. Este es el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Por tanto cuenta de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se siente bien con su banco comunal, pues considera que es un grupo solidario y unido.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas consiguiendo precios más cómodos por el volumen de sus compras, deseando aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jackeline, 27, is a hardworking, enterprising woman in addition to being cordial and kind.  She’s separated from the father of her son, Collin, 4.  She lives with her brother and her son who she loves very much in her own house.  Jackeline’s activity is selling food all day, a business she carries out in front of her house.  She started it with an MFP loan.  She sets up a table in her front porch every day to take care of customers.  She started four years ago with help from a young woman who is her helper; she pays her 50 soles a week.  She temporarily suspended this business because she managed to secure a job and signed a contract as a teacher; this will allow her to have steady income.

She likes her business because it’s brought her economic and personal satisfactions because she had many economic difficulties because the child support she gets from her son’s father is insufficient and that’s why she decided to start a business and seeing that it was profitable decided to continue with it.  Now that she has the opportunity provided by her having a steady job she hopes to have time to restart her business.

This is MFP loan #4 so she now has a small loan available to reach her objectives.  She feels good in her communal bank because she considers the group to be united and supportive.  She used the requested 1500 new soles to buy ingredients to prepare food.  She wanted to increase working capital and was able to get better prices because she bought in volume.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Nazirjon

texts.ru: Назирчон родился в 1970 году. Он женат и на воспитании имеет3 детей. Его жена Сочида домохозяйка и она занимается воспитанием детей. Дети Шарифчон, Шохидахон и Парвизчон учатся в школе и университете. Назирчон занимается купле продажей мясных и молочных продуктов, но его доход не позволяет ему оплатить за учебы сына в университете, так как Парвизчон в этом году окончил школу и поступил в Новосибирский Государственный Медицинский Университет по специальности стоматолога. Парвизчон окончил школу с золотой медалью. Он очень способный парень. В свободное время читает книги и занимается спортом. Назирчон запрашивает кредит для оплаты учебы сына в университете. Назирчон и Парвизчон ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nazirjon was born in 1970. He is married and bringing up three children. His wife, Sochida, is a homemaker and dedicates herself to raising their children. The children, Sharifchon, Shokhidakhon and Parvizchon, are in secondary school and at the university. Nazirjon buys and resells meat and dairy products, but his income is insufficient to pay for his son’s university tuition. This year Parvizchon has graduated from high school and  has been admitted to the Novosibirsk State Medical University, Department of Dentistry. Parvizchon has graduated from high school with a golden medal [awarded to students with excellent grades]. He is a gifted young man. In his free time he reads books and  engages in sports. Nazirjon is requesting a loan in order to pay for his son’s study at the university. Nazirjon and Parvizchon are counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s study at the university.

loans.name: Ricardo Sebastian

texts.es:
El Sr. Ricardo inicio hace aproximadamente 15 años su negocio debido a que lo liquidaron de su trabajo. Después de ese evento en su vida decidió establecer su propio negocio poco a poco creció económicamente con las ventas hasta llegar a tener una tienda bien surtida.
En la actualidad su horario de trabajo inicia desde las 6:00am cuando se dirige  al mercado a comprar las legumbres frescas y su esposa queda ateniendo la tienda. Cierra el negocio  a las 22:00pm. Unas de sus dificultades es un poco la delincuencia, pero ahora la policía está realizando operativos por su casa con más frecuencia. 
Ricardo  tiene 2 hijos pero ya son mayores de edad y viven independientemente. Con el préstamo va a comprar arroz, azúcar y víveres. Unos de sus metas para los próximos 5 años es poder comprar material de construcción , cemento hierro y arena para seguir avanzando en mejorar su vivienda
texts.en:
Ricardo started his business about 15 years ago because he was let go from work.  After that event in his life he decided to start his own business and gradually it grew economically in sales until it became a well-stocked store. 

His work schedule starts at 6am when he heads out to the market to buy fresh vegetables; his wife watches the store.  He closes the store at 10pm.  One of his difficulties is crime but the police is making its presence known in his neighborhood more frequently now.

Ricardo has two children but they are both independent adults now.  He will use the loan to buy rice, sugar and groceries.  One of his goals for the next five years is to buy building materials, cement, rebar and sand, to continue improving his house.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and groceries.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a patient mother. She is 52 years old, married, and had children but lives separately from them. They have their own family already. 

She operates a talipapa (fruit and vegetable stall) in their village. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month selling fruits and vegetables. 

Now, she is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy tomatoes, cabbages, and eggplants to sell,. She hopes to sell more products and gain additional income from it.

She also hopes to save a fund for use in times of emergencies, for she and her husband are getting weak and old.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbages, and eggplant to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his mother's medical expenses.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 6,360 pesos Mary ha podido comprar mercancía para ampliar y renovr su inventario. Hace dos años que Mary inició este negocio de venta de ropa y accesorios para poder pagar su estudios en la universidad.
Mary es soltera y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive con sus padres, ya que esta es la costumbre en su país.
Ella desea que le vaya bien en su negocio para poder terminar la universidad.
texts.en: With a 6,360 peso loan Mary was able to buy merchandise to expand and renew her inventory.  Mary started this clothing and accessories sales business two years ago in order to pay for her university studies.  Mary is single and has no children.  She currently lives with her parents since this is the custom in her country.  She hopes to do well in her business in order to complete her university studies.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 56 años tiene un hijo que tiene la edad de 17 años,  ella se dedica  a la  elaboración de galletas como primera actividad y también se dedica a  la venta y  crianza de cerdos en la localidad de Abapo como segunda actividad, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María va a usar este préstamo para la compra de cerdos para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de cerdos, la Sra. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad en la alimentación de sus cerdos,  su deseo es poder tener una granja donde pueda criar cantidad de cerdos para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María, 56, has a 17-year-old son.   Her main occupation is baking cookies but she also has a second occupation raises pigs to sell in Abapo.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and María is going to use it to buy pigs for her business.  The reason for this loan requests is the lack of capital to purchase pigs.  The business challenge María faces is to improve her life; she will use profits to improve the pigs’ feeding.  Her wish is to have a farm where she can raise a good number of pigs and improve her economic stability this way.
.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Aurora, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en el distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia se dedica a la fabricación de muebles de oficina en melamina que es la madera procesada y prensada. Aurora necesita aumentar la producción de sus muebles,  para cumplir con las solicitudes de los clientes, por ello solicita el préstamo para comprar planchas de melamina.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Aurora pertenece al banco comunal “Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
Aurora está trabajando mucho para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, 2 de los cuales en edad escolar,  y para ella es todo su sacrificio.
texts.en:
Aurora is 47-years-old, is married, and has 3 children. She lives in the Santiago district in the city of Cusco. Aurora works in the production of office furniture, specifically in melamine that is processed and pressed wood. 

Aurora needs to increase the production of her furniture to comply with the requests of the clients.  For this reason she needs a loan in order to purchase plates of melamine.  Aurora is very grateful with Kiva for helping her to develop her activities and she promises to comply with timely payments. 

Aurora is part of the community bank “Rumbo al Exito- Santiago” (Toward Success- Santiago) in the city of Cusco, Peru. Aurora is working hard to offer her children a better future. Two of her children are of school age and for her all of her work is a sacrifice for her family.

loans.use: to purchase plates of melamine

loans.name: Mariana Genoveva

texts.es:
Mariana tiene 37 años es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos uno de 14 y otro de 3 años. Ella siempre le ha gustado las ventas  por lo cual opto por tener un negocio propio. Tuvo la oportunidad de vender por catalogo productos de belleza y cosméticos tales como Yanbal, L´BEL también vende ropa por catalogo.
En la actualidad Mariana tiene varios años en este negocio de venta de cosméticos y le va muy bien. Ha Mariana le gusta el negocio porque tiene tiempo para cuidar a sus hijos el cual requieren de sus cuidados. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cosméticos como cremas, maquillaje, perfumes etc. 
La meta de Mariana es continuar con su negocio y tener un local para habilitar un Bazar y así tener un mejor ingreso
texts.en:
Mariana is a 37-year-old single mother. She has two children, one is 14 years old and the other is 3 years old. She has always liked sales and for this reason she opted to have her own business. She had the opportunity to sell beauty and cosmetic products by catalog such as Yanbal and L’Bel products. She also sells clothing in the catalog. Mariana has several years of experience working in her cosmetic sales business and nowadays she is doing well. 

Mariana enjoys working in this kind of business because it allows her the time to take care of her children.  With the loan she wants to buy cosmetics such as creams, make-up, and perfumes, etc. Mariana’s ultimate goal is to continue her business and to open a store and to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase cream, make-up, and perfumes.

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en:
Mirjana is living in a village of a Serbian community in Kosovo. She is married with two children, ages 2 and 5 years old. Four years ago, she opened a tire store business with her husband, which serves as the main source of income for her family.  

At this store, they fix tires for various vehicles. They have been fortunate enough that each year they increase their business and income from the store. They serve local people who live within the community and those that are traveling and passing through. 

Mirjana is requesting a loan in order to buy a machine to balance tires. In the future, Mirjana hopes to expand the business and improve the living conditions for her family and growing children. 

She is very happy for this opportunity and thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a machine to balance tires

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor  tiene 36 años y es soltero, el se dedica  a la fabricación de  sillas de bejuco es una planta el utiliza sus tallos, realiza esta actividad desde hace ya varios años actividad que aprendió de su padre,  el vive en la localidad de san Jose,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Víctor va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una moto ya que esta le permitirá movilizarse de un lugar a otro ofreciendo su trabajo, Víctor enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, su deseo es vender sus productos artesanales a distintas localidades y también a la ciudad de Santa cruz y  ser uno de los mejores artesanos, se siente feliz  y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Victor is 36 years old and single. He earns a living making wicker chairs from "bejuco" (a kind of plant that you use the stems of), a trade he learned from his father and has been doing for a number of years. He lives in the city of San Jose. 

This loan is his first within the institution. Victor is going to use this loan to buy a motorcycle which will allow him to get from one place to another for his work. Victor faces challenges in his business: he wants to get out of poverty and improve his quality of life. He wishes are to sell his artisan products in different locations including the city of Santa Cruz and to be considered one of the finest artisans. He feels happy and grateful for the support given by the institution.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Liria

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 26,250 pesos Liria ha podido comprar un saco de arroz, aceite, azucar y bebidas refrescantes para su puesto de venta de comidas.
Liria inició este negocio hace un año para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar sin tener que ser empleada, pues tiene una niña de 4 años a la que quiere atender. En la mañana, que es el tiempo más ocupado de Liria, la niña está en el preescolar y en las tardes está con ella en el puesto de comida.
El sueño de Liria es que su negocio crezca para seguir ayudando a su esposo sosteniendo el hogar y estar con su niña, pues quiere participar de manera activa en la crianza y educación de su hija
texts.en:
With a loan of 26,250 pesos, Liria has been able to buy a sack of rice, oil, sugar, and refreshing drinks for her food stall.  

Liria started this business a year ago to help her husband with the household expenses without having to look for a job, as she has a four-year-old daughter that she wants to be there for.  In the morning, which is Liria's busiest time, her little girl is in preschool and in the afternoon she is with her at the food stall.

Liria's dream is for her business to grow so she can keep helping her husband support their household and to be with her little girl, as she wants to be an active participant in her daughter's upbringing and education.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, oil, sugar and refreshing drinks for her food stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay their son`s college fee.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador is a farmer and a retail store owner, too. While he is on the farm, his wife manages the store. They work hard in order to sustain the family's needs for meals and the allowance of his child. He earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos (P) monthly from the store. 

He is now asking for a loan of P 13,000 to invest in buying additional merchandise for the retail store. He will buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and biscuits to sell in the store. He promises to pay back his loan and keep extending good customer service.

Someday, he hopes their businesses will give them good profits for the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and biscuits to sell in the store.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita operates a small food stall at the nearby school. She has been doing this for five years now and she earns PHP 3,000 each month. She has two children but lives separately from them. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy biscuits, juice drinks, candies, and breads to sell. 

She hopes this loan will be given to her as a way of business improvement. She will save additional revenue to use in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, juice drinks, candies, and breads to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 51 years old and married to Maso. They are blessed with two children, aged 17 and 3 years old. He has been in business for one year in which he earns KES 5,500 income. This is his first business loan with KADET LTD and he plans to buy more farm inputs.

He will use the profit he gets to educate his children. His dream is to have a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs to use on his farm.

loans.name: Ngorn's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village in the Me Mot district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Ngorn is a 49-year-old mother of seven children, five of whom are dependent on her and still in school. The main source of the family’s income is cassava growing, which she has been engaging in for 10 years. 

Ngorn’s group consists of three members (one female and two males) who live in the same village. She is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. Ngorn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy pesticides for the cassava plantation and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs, as she will hire somebody to clear grass. Through this loan, Ngorn hopes her business is more profitable, and then, her family can live in a better condition.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for protecting her cassava planting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Me Mot district

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida. She previously borrowed 50,000 PHP through CCT that she used to purchase quantities and varieties of grocery items and products for her sari-sari, or grocery shop. Her earnings were a big help in meeting her family's personal, household and business costs and paying for her children’s education.

Aida is applying for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her shop’s inventory. She feels that the more items displayed in the store, the better, as more items to sell should result in greater profits. She looks forward to this new loan with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

All CCT community clients, of which Aida is one, are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages and other products to add to her shop’s inventory.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is pictured in his grocery store.

Mohammad is a 29-year-old single young man. He lives with his mother and his sister. For the past 15 years, Mohammad has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries.  It has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family, but not enough to cover the costs.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, canned food, sugar, and dairy products. 

This will increase sales and increase Mohammad's income, which will offer to the family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase needed stock of basic groceries for sale in his grocery store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Vilma, tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y madre de  2 hijos,  vive en el distrito Santiago del Cusco, la socia tiene un almacén y se dedica a la   comercialización de productos como cerveza, gaseosas, abarrotes en general y gas domestico.
Vilma invertirá su préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería para capitalizar su actividad.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla en el fortalecimiento de su actividad. Vilma pertenece al banco comunal “Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is Vilma, who is 45 years old, single, and the mother of 2 children. She lives in the Santiago del Cusco district, where she has a warehouse and works to market products such as beer, soda, grocery items, and gas for household use. Vilma will use the loan she is asking for to buy merchandise to grow her business.

Vilma is very grateful to KIVA for helping her in strengthening her business. She belongs to the community bank "Rumbo al Éxito-Santiago" in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase beer, soda, groceries, and household gas.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío, de 44 años, es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, tiene muchas ganas de progresar.  Es madre de 2 menores hijas con quienes vive en casa propia junto a su esposo con quien lleva varios años de casada. Rocío tiene como trabajo el de la venta de golosinas y postres en la puerta de su casa, además ella tiene varios cuartos en su casa los cuales alquila y significa un ingreso más para su economía. 
Lleva en éste trabajo más de 10 años, lo hace en su casa y tiene la ayuda de sus hijas, aunque por el momento la venta de dulces y raspadillas no lo está haciendo muy seguido, pues el clima en la zona varia y eso no le permite completar exitosamente su venta, pero ella como es una mujer de negocios ya está viendo la manera de poder generar ganancias con otro tipo de inversión.
Considera a sus negocio bastantes rentables por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que le da buenos ingresos, además de poder estar en su casa con sus hijas, ella espera mas adelante mejorar las condiciones de su casa para así alquilar sus cuartos a mejor precio. Este es el préstamo número4 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que le permitirá estar tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Por otro lado,  a compenetrarse con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará materiales para construcción ya que comenzará con la ampliación de sus cuartos y mejorará las condiciones de los mismos, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus inquilinos.
texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Rocío is a very responsible and hardworking woman.  She has a real drive to get ahead.  She is the mother of two young girls who live with her in her own home along with her husband, whom she has been married to for several years.  Rocío works selling candies and desserts from her front door.  She also has several rooms in her house that she rents, which mean more income for her finances.

She has been doing this work for over 10 years.  She does it in her home and she has the help of her daughters, though she does not sell candy and snow cones all the time because the climate in the area varies, which keeps her from being more successful in her sales.  However, as she is a businesswoman, she is already figuring out a way to make more money through a different kind of investment.

She believes that her businesses are fairly profitable because of the good earnings she makes.

What she likes most about her work is that her profits are good.  She also likes being able to be at home with her daughters.  In the future, she hopes to improve conditions in her home so she can rent her rooms at a better price.  This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support, as this allows her to have peace of mind and to move forward with her plans for her business.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  She gets along well with the members of her communal bank, all of whom are very supportive.  With the requested 1,500 soles, she will buy construction materials to begin to expand her rooms and improve conditions in them in order to offer her tenants a better service.

loans.use: to buy materials to build more rooms.

loans.name: Mayflor

texts.en:
Mayflor, 23, is single and lives with her parents. For almost four years she has sold groceries from her shop to people in her village.

Mayflor runs this shop because she didn't finish her degree that would perhaps have helped her find a good job. Despite her situation, though, she is happy to make money from her small store and so supplement the family's income.

Mayflor is now applying for a loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI to buy sugar, milk, canned goods and soft drinks to sell in her store. She hopes to better her shop and see her income rise.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, canned goods and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
She is married and has five children, with three below the ages of fifteen years. The entire family lives in a three-room apartment house at Bayelle, Bamenda, Northwest region of Cameroon.

She has gone through enormous difficulties in her life like inadequate capital to start up a business, and general poverty within the family, so much that she is unable to take care of her children’s education and health needs. The sudden death of her sister also was heartbreaking and one of her children being sick for two years. 

This loan will be used to buy beans, rice, fuel wood, and palm oil in greater quantities and more of other provision items.

This activity will succeed because she is well located; the increase in the demand for her business’ products within her community, and longevity. Thus she has many customers. 

It is helpful to the community because they will buy their little provision items from within, thus saving the cost of transportation. The profits will help improve the healthcare of the family, provide better education to her children, and a general increase in their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, fuel wood, and palm oil in greater quantities.

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en:
Sat, 47, lives in Dambae, a rural area in Kampong Cham District, Cambodia. She is married and has four children.

For the past twenty years Sat has farmed rice in a one-hectare paddy and grown cassava on a 2.5-hectare field. She is able to earn about 30,000 KHR a day and manages to save around 10,000 KHR a day.

Sat previously received a loan through Kiva’s partner VisionFund, which helped her to ease her family’s life and improve her farm. Sat is now the leader of a group of two (she and Boeurn, shown here) applying for a loan with VisionFund. She plans to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pay for laborers to work her land.

Sat hopes to increase her crops’ yield so as to make more money and fulfill her dream of building a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for laborers to work her land.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es:
Gilda, de 48 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, alegre y carismática.
Está casada  con Lucio quien es docente, fruto de esa unión tienen 3 hijos; Leyder, Patricia y Elar de 26, 23 y 21 años de edad respectivamente, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad la cual lograron comprar a base de mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Gilda  es la venta de comidas, como menús y platos extras, contando con un pequeño local que logró ambientar en su propia casa, en donde puso sus mesas y sillas necesarias para atender cómodamente a sus clientes, con sus deliciosos platillos, con la buena sazón de casa que aprendió de su madre,  logrando ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes. También realiza la costura de ropas interiores por las tardes, logrando ganarse muchos  clientes por su buena atención.
Se inició  hace más de 6 años, tiempo que viene funcionando su negocio y viene atendiendo con el apoyo de una ayudante que le ayuda  y a la que paga por mes.
Le gusta su actividad por  tener un ingreso económico con el cual apoya en los gastos del hogar a su pareja, ya que muchas veces con los ingresos de empleado en una entidad privada de su pareja no les alcanzaba, entonces decidió iniciar su negocio. Por  otro lado,  no le gusta su actividad pues resulta ser agotador al termino de cada día de trabajo, pero eso no la desanima y sigue trabajando deseosa de progresar. Por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio, mejorar sus ambientes y variar sus platillos, además de poner una venta de verduras en el frontis de su casa. Este es el préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo comunal que conforma, ya que considera a sus miembros ser personas responsable y comprometidas con sus obligaciones. Con el monto solicitado de 2600 nuevo soles. Los invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas, como arroz, aceites, menestras y demás, buscando menores precios para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Gilda is 48 years old. She is a hard working and enterprising woman, happy and charismatic. She is married to Lucio who is a teacher, and they have 3 children, Leyder, Patricia and Elar of 26, 23, and 21 years of age respectively, living in their own house which they managed to buy through their many efforts.

Gilda sells food, from a menu with extra dishes, in a small facility that she adapted in her own home, where she put the tables and chairs needed to accommodate her customers, with delicious dishes, with good homemade flavors that she learned from her mother, earning the appreciation of her clients. She also sews undergarments in the evenings, winning many clients through her good service. She started her business more than six years ago, and has an assistant helping whom she pays monthly. 

She likes her work because she has an income that helps her husband with the household expenses, because many times the earnings of her husband as an employee of a private entity was not enough, so she decided to start her business. On the other hand she does not like it because she is exhausted at the end of each working day. But that does not discourage her and she continues working wanting to get ahead. This is why she has plans to grow her business, improving the atmosphere and varying the dishes, and also she wants to sell vegetables in front of her house.

This is her 13th loan through MFP. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit so that she can get ahead in her business, and thus she agrees to complete payment of the loans as she has with previous ones. Furthermore, she feels comfortable with the communal group that she is a member of as she considers them to be responsible and committed people with their obligations. With the requested amount of 2600 soles she will invest in the purchase of ingredients for the preparation of food, such as rice, oil, beans and other items searching for low prices in order to have higher profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and beans for the delicious homemade food she prepares in her home-based business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, de 61 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora.  Está casada con Silvio quien es comerciante, ella es madre de 3 hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes, ahora solo trabaja para ella y su nieta de 13 años a quien educa y cría pues desea hacerla un elemento bueno para la sociedad. Durante los días de la semana, Erlinda se dedica a la confección de sabanas de diversos diseños, además de algunas fundas para almohadas, muebles y juegos completos de dormitorio, tiene su pequeño taller que acondicionó en  su casa donde realiza todo su trabajo. 
Lleva con éste negocio más de 12 años, en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijas o de su nieta, pues ella sale a ofrecer sus productos los fines de semana a amigos, vecinos y familiares o a cualquier cliente que desee tener una juego de dormitorio de buena calidad y a muy buen precio.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite tener tiempo para ver a sus animalitos y a sus plantas ya que uno de sus pasatiempos favoritos es sembrar flores en su jardín. Tiene muchos planes a futuro ya que desea seguir creciendo y haciendo prosperar su negocio. Por tanto desea continuar con su negocio. Este será el crédito número 12 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un respaldo financiero ya que le dará la garantía de seguir trabajando tranquila, ella por su parte está comprometida en seguir siendo una socia puntual en sus cuotas así como fue en anteriores créditos que tuvo.  Además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 4000 soles, comprará materiales para seguir haciendo su trabajo como telas para sabanas, hilos, elásticos, entre otros, y lograr aumentar su producción, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en: Erlinda is a kind, friendly, hard-working 61 year old woman. She is married to Silvio, who is a shopkeeper, and is the mother of 3 grown children.
